title: General plots
code: data <- data.frame('x' = c(1:20), 'y' = rnorm(20), 'Type' = rep(c('A','B'), 10)) palette <- c("#f89588","#63b2ee") Bior_LinePlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", color = "Type", title = "Test Bior_LinePlot",               palette = palette, plot_type = "l", size = 2, text.size = 30,               ggtheme = theme_minimal()) +   font("title", size = 35)

title: General plots
code: x <- c(3,7,9,1,2) labels <- c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E") col <- c("#AEC7E8B2", "#FFBB78B2", "#98DF8AB2", "#FF9896B2", "#C5B0D5B2") p <- Bior_PiePlot(x, labels, col=col, title="Test Bior_pie") p

title: General plots
code: data <- data.frame(matrix(rnorm(20, mean = 20, sd = 5),c(4,5))) data <- round(data) rownames(data) <- paste('gene',1:4, sep='') colnames(data) <- paste('sample',1:5,sep='') x.order <- c('sample1','sample5','sample4','sample3','sample2') type.order <- c('gene1','gene2','gene3','gene4') col <- c("#AEC7E8FF","#FFBB78FF","#98DF8AFF","#FF9896FF") p <- Bior_StackBarplot(data, x.order=x.order, type.order=type.order, col = col,                   labs.x='Samples', labs.y='Numbers', title='Test Bior_StackBarplot',                   theme=theme_minimal()) p

title: General plots
code: x <- rep(paste('sample', 1:5, sep=''), 4) y <- rep(paste('gene', 1:4, sep=''), 5) size <- round(rnorm(20, mean = 10, sd = 5)) colour <- c("#1F77B4FF","#FF7F0EFF","#2CA02CFF","#D62728FF","#9467BDFF") p <- Bior_DotPlot(x = x, y = y, size = size, group.by = x, colour = colour, max_size=10) p

title: General plots
code: # links data, colnames must have 'source' 'target' 'value' links <- data.frame(   source=c("C","A", "B", "E", "D"),    target=c("b","c", "a", "e", "d"),    value=c(1, 2, 0, 4, 5) )  # Set Nodes order and colour Nodes.order <- c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "a", "b", "c", "d", "e") Nodes.colour <- c("#1F77B4B2","#FF7F0EB2","#2CA02CB2","#D62728B2","#9467BDB2",                   "#8C564BB2","#E377C2B2","#7F7F7FB2","#BCBD22B2","#17BECFB2") p <- Bior_Sankeyplot(links, Nodes.order=Nodes.order, Nodes.colour=Nodes.colour, fontSize=20) p # Use saveNetwork() to save the plot as html # saveNetwork(p,"sankey.html")

title: Dot Plot — Bior_DotPlot
code: Bior_DotPlot(   x,   y,   size,   group.by,   colour = NULL,   max_size = 5,   text.size = 15,   breaks = waiver(),   theme = theme_bw(),   labs.x = "",   labs.y = "",   title = "",   legendtitle.color = "Types",   legendtitle.size = "Value" )

title: Dot Plot — Bior_DotPlot
text: x vector, x-axis value y vector, y-axis value size vector, point size value group.color group x y colour colour max_size max point size text.size text size breaks scale_size_area(breaks) theme choose ggthemes, default:theme_bw() labs.x labs x labs.y labs y title title legendtitle.color guides(color=guide_legend(legendtitle.color)) legendtitle.size guides(size=guide_legend(legendtitle.size))

title: Dot Plot — Bior_DotPlot
code: # Examples 1 x <- rep(paste('sample', 1:5, sep=''), 4) y <- rep(paste('gene', 1:4, sep=''), 5) size <- round(rnorm(20, mean = 10, sd = 5)) colour <- c("#1F77B4FF","#FF7F0EFF","#2CA02CFF","#D62728FF","#9467BDFF") p <- Bior_DotPlot(x = x, y = y, size = size, group.by = x, colour = colour, max_size=10) p

title: Line plot — Bior_LinePlot
code: Bior_LinePlot(   data,   x,   y,   group = 1,   numeric.x.axis = FALSE,   combine = FALSE,   merge = FALSE,   color = "black",   palette = NULL,   linetype = "solid",   plot_type = c("b", "l", "p"),   size = 0.5,   shape = 19,   stroke = NULL,   point.size = size,   point.color = color,   title = NULL,   xlab = NULL,   ylab = NULL,   facet.by = NULL,   panel.labs = NULL,   short.panel.labs = TRUE,   select = NULL,   remove = NULL,   order = NULL,   add = "none",   add.params = list(),   error.plot = "errorbar",   label = NULL,   font.label = list(size = 11, color = "black"),   label.select = NULL,   repel = FALSE,   label.rectangle = FALSE,   show.line.label = FALSE,   position = "identity",   ggtheme = theme_pubr(),   title.hjust = 0.5,   text.size = 20,   ... )

title: Line plot — Bior_LinePlot
text: data data frame x, y x y variables drawing. group grouping variable connect points line. Allowed values 1 (one line, one group) character vector specifying name grouping variable (case multiple lines). numeric.x.axis logical. TRUE, x axis treated numeric. Default FALSE. combine logical value. Default FALSE. Used y vector containing multiple variables plot. TRUE, create multi-panel plot combining plot y variables. merge logical character value. Default FALSE. Used y vector containing multiple variables plot. TRUE, merge multiple y variables plotting area. Allowed values include also "asis" (TRUE) "flip". merge = "flip", y variables used x tick labels x variable used grouping variable. color line colors. palette color palette used coloring filling groups. Allowed values include "grey" grey color palettes; brewer palettes e.g. "RdBu", "Blues", ...; custom color palette e.g. c("blue", "red"); scientific journal palettes ggsci R package, e.g.: "npg", "aaas", "lancet", "jco", "ucscgb", "uchicago", "simpsons" "rickandmorty". linetype line type. plot_type plot type. Allowed values one "b" line point; "l" line ; "p" point . Default "b". size Numeric value (e.g.: size = 1). change size points outlines. shape point shapes. stroke point stroke. Used shapes 21-24 control thickness points border. point.size point size. point.color point color. title plot main title. xlab character vector specifying x axis labels. Use xlab = FALSE hide xlab. ylab character vector specifying y axis labels. Use ylab = FALSE hide ylab. facet.character vector, length 1 2, specifying grouping variables faceting plot multiple panels. data. panel.labs list one two character vectors modify facet panel labels. example, panel.labs = list(sex = c("Male", "Female")) specifies labels "sex" variable. two grouping variables, can use example panel.labs = list(sex = c("Male", "Female"), rx = c("Obs", "Lev", "Lev2") ). short.panel.labs logical value. Default TRUE. TRUE, create short labels panels omitting variable names; words panels labelled variable grouping levels. select character vector specifying items display. remove character vector specifying items remove plot. order character vector specifying order items. add character vector adding another plot element (e.g.: dot plot error bars). Allowed values one combination : "none", "dotplot", "jitter", "boxplot", "point", "mean", "mean_se", "mean_sd", "mean_ci", "mean_range", "median", "median_iqr", "median_hilow", "median_q1q3", "median_mad", "median_range"; see ?desc_statby details. add.params parameters (color, shape, size, fill, linetype) argument 'add'; e.g.: add.params = list(color = "red"). error.plot plot type used visualize error. Allowed values one c("pointrange", "linerange", "crossbar", "errorbar", "upper_errorbar", "lower_errorbar", "upper_pointrange", "lower_pointrange", "upper_linerange", "lower_linerange"). Default value "pointrange" "errorbar". Used add != "none" add contains one "mean_*" "med_*" "*" = sd, se, .... label name column containing point labels. Can also character vector length = nrow(data). font.label list can contain combination following elements: size (e.g.: 14), style (e.g.: "plain", "bold", "italic", "bold.italic") color (e.g.: "red") labels. example font.label = list(size = 14, face = "bold", color ="red"). specify size style, use font.label = list(size = 14, face = "plain"). label.select can two formats: character vector specifying labels show. list containing one combination following components: top.top.: display labels  top /points. example, label.select = list(top.= 10, top.= 4). criteria: filter, example, x y variabes values, use : label.select = list(criteria = "`y` > 2 & `y` < 5 & `x` %% c('', 'B')"). repel logical value, whether use ggrepel avoid overplotting text labels . label.rectangle logical value. TRUE, add rectangle underneath text, making easier read. show.line.label logical value. TRUE, shows line labels. position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. ggtheme function, ggplot2 theme name. Default value theme_pubr(). Allowed values include ggplot2 official themes: theme_gray(), theme_bw(), theme_minimal(), theme_classic(), theme_void(), .... title.hjust (defaut: title.hjust = 0.5); title hjust value text.size (defaut: text.size = 20); text size value ... arguments passed geom_dotplot.

title: Line plot — Bior_LinePlot
code: # Examples 1 data <- data.frame('x' = c(1:20), 'y' = rnorm(20), 'Type' = rep(c('A','B'), 10)) palette <- c("#f89588","#63b2ee") Bior_LinePlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", color = "Type", title = "Test Bior_LinePlot",               palette = palette, plot_type = "l", size = 2, text.size = 30,               ggtheme = theme_minimal()) +   font("title", size = 35)

title: Pie Plot — Bior_PiePlot
code: Bior_PiePlot(   x,   labels,   col = pal_d3("category20,", alpha = 0.7)(20),   title = "",   fontsize = 20,   legend.key.size = 1 )

title: Pie Plot — Bior_PiePlot
text: x vector value labels vector labels x col colour title title fontsize fontsize legend.key.size legend size

title: Pie Plot — Bior_PiePlot
code: # Examples 1 x <- c(3,7,9,1,2) labels <- c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E") col <- c("#AEC7E8B2", "#FFBB78B2", "#98DF8AB2", "#FF9896B2", "#C5B0D5B2") p <- Bior_PiePlot(x, labels, col=col, title="Test Bior_PiePlot") p

title: Sankey Plot — Bior_Sankeyplot
code: Bior_Sankeyplot(   links,   Nodes.colour = NULL,   Nodes.order = NULL,   fontSize = 12,   nodeWidth = 30,   nodePadding = 10,   margin = NULL,   height = 600,   width = 600,   sinksRight = TRUE )

title: Sankey Plot — Bior_Sankeyplot
text: links dataframe, colnames must ‘source’ ‘target’ ‘value’ Nodes.colour Set nodes colour Nodes.order Set nodes order fontSize Set fontsize nodeWidth Set nodewidth nodePadding Set gap size nodes margin R margin height numeric height network graph’s frame area pixels width numeric width network graph’s frame area pixels sinksRight boolean. TRUE, last nodes moved right border plot

title: Sankey Plot — Bior_Sankeyplot
code: # Examples 1 # links data, colnames must have 'source' 'target' 'value' links <- data.frame(   source=c("C","A", "B", "E", "D"),   target=c("b","c", "a", "e", "d"),   value=c(1, 2, 0, 4, 5) )  # Set Nodes order and colour Nodes.order <- c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "a", "b", "c", "d", "e") Nodes.colour <- c("#1F77B4B2","#FF7F0EB2","#2CA02CB2","#D62728B2","#9467BDB2",                   "#8C564BB2","#E377C2B2","#7F7F7FB2","#BCBD22B2","#17BECFB2") p <- Bior_Sankeyplot(links, Nodes.order=Nodes.order, Nodes.colour=Nodes.colour, fontSize=20) p  {"x":{"links":{"source":[1,0,2,3],"target":[4,5,6,7],"value":[1,2,5,4],"group":["C","A","D","E"]},"nodes":{"name":["A","C","D","E","b","c","d","e"],"group":["A","C","D","E","b","c","d","e"]},"options":{"NodeID":"name","NodeGroup":"name","LinkGroup":"Group","colourScale":"d3.scaleOrdinal() .domain([\"A\", \"B\", \"C\", \"D\", \"E\", \"a\", \"b\", \"c\", \"d\", \"e\"]) .range([\"#1F77B4B2\", \"#FF7F0EB2\", \"#2CA02CB2\", \"#D62728B2\", \"#9467BDB2\", \"#8C564BB2\", \"#E377C2B2\", \"#7F7F7FB2\", \"#BCBD22B2\", \"#17BECFB2\"])","fontSize":20,"fontFamily":null,"nodeWidth":30,"nodePadding":10,"units":"","margin":{"top":null,"right":null,"bottom":null,"left":null},"iterations":0,"sinksRight":true}},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

title: Stack Barplot — Bior_StackBarplot
code: Bior_StackBarplot(   data,   x.order = NULL,   type.order = NULL,   col = scales::hue_pal(),   label.size = 5,   labs.x = "",   labs.y = "",   title = "",   legend.key.size = 1,   text.size = 15,   bar.width = 0.7,   theme = theme_bw() )

title: Stack Barplot — Bior_StackBarplot
text: data dataframe, columns x-axis sample, rows fill type x.order x axis sample order type.order fill type order col fill colours label.size label size labs.x x axis title labs.y y axis title title figure title legend.key.size legend size text.size text size bar.width bar width theme choose ggthemes, eg:theme_bw(), theme_classic()

title: Stack Barplot — Bior_StackBarplot
code: # Examples 1 data <- data.frame(matrix(rnorm(20, mean = 20, sd = 5),c(4,5))) data <- round(data) rownames(data) <- paste('gene',1:4, sep='') colnames(data) <- paste('sample',1:5,sep='') x.order <- c('sample1','sample5','sample4','sample3','sample2') type.order <- c('gene1','gene2','gene3','gene4') col <- c("#AEC7E8FF","#FFBB78FF","#98DF8AFF","#FF9896FF") p <- Bior_StackBarplot(data, x.order=x.order, type.order=type.order, col = col,                        labs.x='Samples', labs.y='Numbers', title='Test Bior_StackBarplot',                        theme=theme_minimal()) p
